Class DrawFloorPlan

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  DrawFloorPlan
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class DrawFloorPlan
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Draw the floor plan based on the binary tree given. This pane may be displayed in its own window or within a split pane. The actual binary tree drawing takes place in the binary tree class. This class is responsible for defining the window parameters and launching the floor plan drawing process. The floor plan is split 50/50 between nodes.

Version:
1.0 2005-OCT-21
Author:
Rob Bauer
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

setupPanel

private void setupPanel()
Setup the window pane.

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
Perform the actual floor plan drawing on the panel. Defines the drawing parameters and draws the plan as well as draws the status bar. If the window gets resized or needs redrawing, this method will refresh the drawing.

Overrides:
paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
See Also:
JComponent.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)

drawStatusBar

private void drawStatusBar(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Draw the status bar. Paints a box at the bottom of the window and lets the user know about the floor plan used.

Parameters:
g - Graphics2D to draw with

drawFloorPlanFromTree

private void drawFloorPlanFromTree(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                                   BinaryTree tree)
Draw the floor plan. Before doing so, define some parameters of the current drawing window.

Parameters:
g - Graphics2D to draw on
tree - Tree to draw the floor plan from
